Theme System

LuxeUI's powerful theming system lets you define global design tokens that automatically flow to all components using SwiftUI's environment.

How It Works

The theme system uses SwiftUI's @Environment to inject design tokens at the root of your app. All LuxeUI components automatically read these tokens, ensuring consistent styling throughout your interface.

Swift 
import SwiftUI
import LuxeUI

@main
struct MyApp: App {
    var body: some Scene {
        WindowGroup {
            ContentView()
                .luxeTheme(.midnight)  // All children inherit this theme
        }
    }
}
üí°
Theme Inheritance

You only need to apply the theme once at the root level. All child views and LuxeUI components will automatically use the theme's colors, typography, spacing, and effects.

Theme Structure

A LuxeUI theme consists of several design token categories:

Category Type Description
colors LuxeColorScheme Primary, secondary, accent, background, surface, text, and status colors
typography LuxeTypography Font sizes (XS to Display), weights, and line heights
spacing LuxeSpacing Spacing scale from xxxs (2pt) to xxxl (64pt)
borderRadius LuxeBorderRadius Corner radius values from none to full (pill)
effects LuxeEffects Shadows, blurs, glows, and animation durations

Accessing Theme Values

Inside any view, you can access the current theme using the environment:

Swift 
struct MyCustomView: View {
    @Environment(\.luxeTheme) private var theme
    
    var body: some View {
        VStack(spacing: theme.spacing.m) {
            Text("Hello")
                .foregroundColor(theme.colors.primary)
                .font(.system(size: theme.typography.fontSizeL))
            
            Text("World")
                .foregroundColor(theme.colors.textSecondary)
        }
        .padding(theme.spacing.l)
        .background(theme.colors.surface)
        .cornerRadius(theme.borderRadius.m)
        .shadow(radius: theme.effects.shadowMedium)
    }
}

Quick Color Access

For convenience, common colors are also available as top-level properties:

Swift 
// Full path
theme.colors.primary
theme.colors.secondary
theme.colors.background

// Shorthand (same values)
theme.primaryColor
theme.secondaryColor
theme.backgroundColor

Real-Time Theme Switching

Themes can be switched dynamically at runtime with smooth animations:

Swift 
struct ThemeSwitcher: View {
    @State private var currentTheme: Theme = .midnight
    
    var body: some View {
        VStack {
            ContentView()
            
            HStack {
                Button("Midnight") { currentTheme = .midnight }
                Button("Sunset") { currentTheme = .sunset }
                Button("Ocean") { currentTheme = .ocean }
            }
        }
        .luxeTheme(currentTheme)
        .animation(.easeInOut, value: currentTheme.primaryColor)
    }
}
